citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADF&G), Subsistence Division
citeinfo.title: Community Profile Database

descript.abstract: Data Type: Infrastructure; The Community Profile Database has been designed to serve as a principal reference source for recent, reliable, summary information about the subsistence uses within the economies of rural Alaskan communities. The database also provides summary information on the commercial-wage sector of a community's economy, recognizing that subsistence uses are part of a mixed subsistence-cash economy in rural Alaska communities. In addition, the database contains information on community demography and community geographic location relative to fish and game management areas, census areas and federal conservation land units. The Community Profile database exists in two forms: (1) a printed database catalog in 6 volumes, and (2) a computerized database system, housed at regional offices of the Division of Subsistence.

idinfo.accconst: The digital database is available at no cost if disks are provided.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
